Author: thepsilonnaught
Content: @[Rec] M Broderick It can be fairly daunting if you're new to programming. The DayZ code-base is not friendly. Start by grabbing an IDE like VSCode and unpack the *scripts.pbo*. That is pretty much the first barrier of entry to scripting. Pilfer through those files, along with the provided server files, and figure out the lifecycle of the server/game. Each component you try to modify has a learning curve that will take some time to understand. Start off slow and make something small. If you want to spawn an item, search the source code or discord for keywords. The default server files pretty much tell you how to spawn items in `init.c`. A lot of implementations and lessons learned are in these channels, so look for them first before delving into whatever you want to tackle next.
